</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Calculated based
upon an estimated tax rate principally based on Global Financing&#146;s geographic
mix of earnings as IBM&#146;s provision for income taxes is determined on a
consolidated basis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">**</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Average of the
ending equity for Global Financing for the last 2 quarters and 3 quarters, for
the three months ended June&nbsp;30, and for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management Discussion &#150; (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Looking
Forward</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Global Financing
business continues to be well positioned to grow in the current environment.
The company&#146;s financial position provides substantial flexibility and funding
capacity. Global Financing&#146;s assets and new financing volumes are primarily IBM
products and services financed to the company&#146;s clients and business partners
and substantially all financing assets are IT related assets which provide a
stable base of business for future growth.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The company&#146;s recently
announced System z and high-end converged System p servers are a significant
financing opportunity. Global Financing&#146;s offerings are competitive and
available to clients as a result of the company&#146;s borrowing cost and access to
the capital markets. Overall, Global Financing&#146;s originations will be dependent
upon the demand for IT products and services, as well as client participation
rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest rates and the
overall economy (including currency fluctuations) will have an effect on both
revenue and gross profit. The company&#146;s interest rate risk management policy,
however, combined with the Global Financing funding strategy should mitigate
gross margin erosion due to changes in interest rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The economy could impact
the credit quality of the Global Financing receivables portfolio and therefore
the level of provision for bad debts. Global Financing will continue to apply
rigorous credit policies in both the origination of new business and the
evaluation of the existing portfolio.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed on page&nbsp;53,
Global Financing has historically been able to manage residual value risk both
through insight into the company&#146;s product cycles, as well as through its
remarketing business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Global Financing has
policies in place to manage each of the key risks involved in financing. These
policies, combined with product and client knowledge, should allow for the
prudent management of the business going forward, even during periods of
uncertainty with respect to the economy.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward Looking and Cautionary Statements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Except for the historical information and
discussions contained herein, statements contained in this release may
constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private
Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&nbsp; These statements involve a
number of risks, uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual
results to differ materially, including the company&#146;s failure to continue to
develop and market new and innovative products and services and to keep pace
with technological change; competitive pressures; failure to obtain or protect
intellectual property rights; breaches of the company&#146;s data security measures;
changes in the economic environment and corporate IT spending budgets;
fluctuations in revenues and purchases, and volatility of stock prices; the
company&#146;s ability to attract and retain key personnel and its reliance on
critical skills; adverse affects from tax matters; environmental matters;
currency fluctuations and customer financing risks; customer credit risk on
receivables; risks from investing in growth opportunities; the company&#146;s
failure to maintain the adequacy of its internal controls; the company&#146;s use of
certain estimates and assumptions; dependence on certain suppliers; changes in
the financial or business condition of the company&#146;s distributors or resellers;
the company&#146;s</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ability to successfully manage acquisitions and
alliances; failure to have sufficient insurance; legal, political, health and
economic conditions; risk factors related to IBM securities; and other risks,
uncertainties and factors discussed in the company&#146;s Form&nbsp;10-Q, Form&nbsp;10-K
and in the company&#146;s other filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange
Commission (SEC) or in materials incorporated therein by reference.&nbsp;The
company assumes no obligation to update or revise any forward-looking
statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 3. Quantitative and
Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk</font></b><a name="Item3_QuantitativeAndQualitativeD_180730"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For quantitative and
qualitative disclosures about market risk affecting IBM, see &#147;Quantitative and
Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk&#148; in Item 7A. of Part&nbsp;II, of the
company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, which is incorporated by reference. The company&#146;s exposure to market risk
has not changed materially since December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of Contents</a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management Discussion &#150; (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> 4.
Controls and Procedures</font></b><a name="Item4_ControlsAndProcedures_180752"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
company&#146;s management evaluated, with the participation of the Chief Executive
Officer and Chief Financial Officer, the effectiveness of the company&#146;s
disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this
report. Based on that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer have concluded that the company&#146;s disclosure controls and
procedures were effective as of the end of the period covered by this report.
There has been no change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting that occurred during the quarter covered by this report that has
materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Part&nbsp;</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">II</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> - Other Information</font></b><a name="PartiiOtherInformation_180740"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 1.&#160; Legal
Proceedings</font></b><a name="Item1_LegalProceedings_180757"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Refer
to Note 14 on pages&nbsp;18 to 21 of this Form&nbsp;10-Q.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
2.&#160; Unregistered Sales of Equity
Securities and Use of Proceeds and Issuer Repurchases of Equity Securities</font></b><a name="Item2_UnregisteredSalesOfEquitySe_180803"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table provides information relating to the company&#146;s repurchase of
common stock for the second quarter of 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 18.2pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-18.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;26, 2008, the Board of Directors
authorized $15.0 billion in funds for use in the company&#146;s common stock
repurchase</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">program; the company stated that it would repurchase
shares on the open market or in private transactions depending on market</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">conditions, and that it expects to use cash from operations for the repurchases.
The common stock repurchase program does not have an expiration date. This
table does not include shares tendered to satisfy the exercise price in
connection with cashless exercises of employee stock options or shares tendered
to satisfy tax withholding obligations in connection with employee equity
awards.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#TableOfContents" title="Click to go to Table of Contents">Table of
Contents</a></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 4. Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security
Holders</font></b><a name="Item4_SubmissionOfMattersToAVoteO_180813"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">International
Business Machines Corporation held its Annual Meeting of Stockholders on April&nbsp;29,
2008. For more information on the following proposals, see the company&#146;s proxy
statement dated March&nbsp;10, 2008, the relevant portions of which are
incorporated herein by reference.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The stockholders elected
each of the eleven nominees to the Board of Directors for a one-year term by a
plurality of votes cast:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="31%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:31.72%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,158,864,303</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.68%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

stockholder proposal on Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
5.&#160; Other Information</font></b><a name="Item5_OtherInformation_180839"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;25, 2008, IBM announced that
the IBM Board of Directors elected Alain J. P. Belda to the Board effective July&nbsp;29,
2008. Article&nbsp;III, Section&nbsp;2 of IBM&#146;s By-laws was amended to increase
the number of directors to twelve&#160;
effective July&nbsp;29, 2008.&#160; The
full text of IBM&#146;s By-laws, as amended, is included as Exhibit&nbsp;3 to this
report.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item</font></b><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;"> 6 (a).
Exhibits</font></b><a name="Item6a_Exhibits_180843"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has
duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned thereunto
duly authorized.</font></p>

  <td width="46%" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:46.02%;">
